form.definition: noun Z is the 26th and last letter of the English alphabet.
noun Zeal is great enthusiasm and energy for what you are doing. She attacked the job of digging up the garden with great zeal.
noun Zero is the number 0. Poor Toby, he got zero in his test. The temperature can fall below zero at night.
adjective In informal language, zero means none at all. Frankly I have zero interest in his problems.
noun Zest is great enjoyment and liveliness in what you are doing. We all joined in the singing with zest.[qr

dictionary.entry:
zigzag`zIgzAgzigzagszigzaggedzigzagging
noun A zigzag is a line with sharp turns or angles which go from one side to the other like a continuous line of Zs.
... WORD FAMILY adjective zigzag verb zigzag The drunken driver was zigzagging all over the road.

form.definition: noun Zinc is a shiny, bluish white metal. It is used to make alloys such as brass and in galvanising iron to prevent it from rusting.[qr

dictionary.entry:
zipzIp
noun A zip is a fastener with two rows of metal or plastic teeth which interlock as you pull a tab up or across, and unlock when you pull it the other way. Zips are often used on clothes and suitcases. ... ANOTHER WORD for this is zipper.

form.definition: noun In astrology and astronomy, the zodiac is a diagram showing the position of the planets and stars in the sky. It is divided into twelve areas which each have a particular constellation or sign of the zodiac.

noun If you call someone a zombie, you mean that they are acting without thinking about what they are doing, perhaps because they are very tired. After a whole night without sleep I was a zombie at the office. The applications are processed by a bunch of zombies who aren't allowed to show any initiative.
noun A zone is a particular area of land or sea. Gunfire broke out as they strayed into the enemy zone. This is a one-hour parking zone.
form.note: ... WORD FAMILY verb zone This land has been zoned for residential use.

form.definition: noun A zoo is a large park where animals of all types from all over the world are kept in enclosures for people to see them.
noun If you study zoology, you study animals and animal life scientifically.
verb In informal language, if you say someone or something zooms somewhere, you mean that they go there very quickly. Where's Tren? He zoomed in a minute ago and zoomed out again.
noun A zucchini is a small vegetable marrow.[xp
